Package imagingbook.common.noise.hashing

Class HashFun

  • java.lang.Object
    • imagingbook.common.noise.hashing.HashFun
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Hash32, HashPermute
    public abstract class HashFun
extends Object
    This class is the abstract superclass of various hash functions. It cannot be instantiated directly, but its subclasses can. Two static methods create() and create(seed) are provided for convenience. Typical use: 
       HashFun hf = new HashFun.create(); // or, alternatively,
   HashFun hf = new Hash32Ward(seed);
   double g = hf.hash(u); // g is in [-1,+1]
   double g = hf.hash(u,v);
   double[] g = hf.hash(u,v,w);
    Omit seed in the constructor call to get a random seed hash function of the specified type.
